nodes.text: The South Sector Boppers were a band of the Cold War era. Sometime around 3643 BBY, they played in the Slippery Slopes Cantina in Nar Shaddaa's Promenade with the following lineup: one female Twi'lek singer, one male Twi'lek strummer, four Kloo players—two Duros or Neimoidian and two Arcona—and a Drall nalargonist.

Their repertoire appears to have included popular songs of the day such as Shapa Keesay, Doe Azalus Ootmian, Smeeleeya Whao Tupee Upee, Kayfoundo Naweea, as well as classic yerk instrumental pieces like Run Kessel Run and Average Brown Wookiee.
